      • receiveData

        public byte[] receiveData(int topic)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Receives the data from the multicast socket. The receiving is blocking; the flow won't continue until a packet is received. The received packet must belong to one of the topics the subscriber receiving the data is subscribed to. If a message of a non-subscribed topic is received, it will be ignored and the loop will continue as if nothing happened.
        Specified by:
        receiveData in class AbstractSocket
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to receive the message of.
        Returns:
        The byte array with received data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurs receiving the packet.
